title: St James type ID
content:
Hi Guys  
can anyone tell me what font was used for  
St James?

cheers

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121145837im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/DC_5065614_3662.jpg)

 [‹ Font suggestion to match old towel embroidery?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121145837/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49964 "Go to previous forum topic") [Serif. Mixture of Garamond and Plantin Schoolbook? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121145837/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49974 "Go to next forum topic")
author: agostini

comments.content: All the letters except for ‘St J’ are set in [Boulevard](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121145837/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/boulevard-bq/).

hmmm thanks...interesting...  
does anyone know what the St J set in?
